title: What is the average salary of a high school teacher in the U.S? - Quora

response.answer_text: According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS): Median annual wages of kindergarten, elementary, middle, and secondary school teachers ranged from $47,100 to $51,180 in May 2008; the lowest 10 percent earned $30,970 to $34,280; the top 10 percent earned $75,190 to $80,970. According to the American Federation of Teachers, beginning teachers with a bachelor's degree earned an average of $33,227 in the 2005-2006 school year. Source: http://www.bls.gov/oco/ocos318.htm Pay Scale puts the median salary at between $40,000 to $42,000 depending on the function and grade level you teach: Source: http://www.payscale.com/research/US/All_K-12_Teachers/Salary My guess is the numbers from the BLS are more authoritative.
